Title: How to Check if a String Contains Only Letters in C# - Code Maze
Description: We will meet different alternatives to check if a string contains only letters and, also, discuss their benefits and drawbacks.

Title: Alexeï Navalny, l’homme qui dérangeait Vladimir Poutine, est mort
Description: Alexeï Navalny, connu pour avoir dénoncé le régime politique et la corruption du gouvernement russe, est mort dans sa colonie pénitentiaire de l’Arctique rus...

Title: Code to Cloud with .NET Aspire
Description: In this session, Distinguished Engineer David Fowler and .NET Product Architect Damian Edwards will talk about how .NET 8 makes building cloud-native apps easier than ever, with powerful new features to turbocharge the development experience.

Title: Introducing project Kiota a client generator for OpenAPI | .NET Conf 2023
Description: Integrating your application with APIs by manually implementing authentication, authorization, serialization, error handling and building requests represents...

Title: Paying people to work on open source is good actually - Jacob Kaplan-Moss
Description: If you have a problem with maintainers getting paid then you have a problem with me and I suggest you let that one marinate.

Title: Using Scoped Services From Singletons in ASP.NET Core
Description: Did you ever need to inject a scoped service into a singleton service? I'll explain how you can solve this problem and safely use scoped services from within singletons in ASP.NET Core.

Title: Forgejo forks its own path forward
Description: Since its inception, Forgejo (a self-hosted git forge, like GitHub) has been a soft fork of Gitea. Upgrading to it was - and for the time being, remains to be - as simple as changing the URL from which the release is downloaded. Over time, the way Forgejo is governed and developed evolved. To be able to provide stable, secure, reliable releases, Forgejo requires a reasonable effort made at writing tests for each change that goes into the code. This has worked out remarkably well, as it caught both regressions in imported code, and mistakes in proposed changes. Furthermore, Forgejo has accepted features and other changes that are not available in Gitea, and has diverged in other ways already.

Title: .NET Continuous Profiler: CPU and Wall Time Profiling
Description: How we implemented CPU and wall time profiling in our .NET continuous profiler.
